Protected Attributes

void * om_

Detailed Description

Outgoing message.

The proxy allowing to track the progress of outgoing message, inspect its state and to obtain the reply content.

Note: The objects of this class can be safely used from multiple threads.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) close

Destructor.

Clean up internal resources associated with this message. This operation should be performed if there is no further need to track the message progress.

- (void) dealloc

Finalizer.

Calls close. Normally called automatically by the runtime.

- (NSString *) exceptionMsg

Returns the exception message.

This function can be called when the state of message is YAMI4Rejected. The return value is newly allocated and should be managed by the caler.

- (YAMI4Parameters *) reply

Provides access to the reply content.

The return value is newly allocated and should be managed by the caler.

- (enum YAMI4MessageState) state: (size_t *)  sentBytes
totalByteCount: (size_t *)  totalByteCount 

Returns the state of this message.

This function allows to inspect the progress of the message transmission. During transmission the sentBytes value is always smaller than totalByteCount. When these two values become equal, it means that the transmission was either succesful or abandoned.

Parameters:
sentBytesThe number of bytes that were already sent for this message.
totalByteCountThe total number of bytes that should be sent for this message.
- (void) waitForCompletion

Waits for the full message roundtrip.

Waits for the full message roundtrip - that is, for some confirmation that the message has been received and reacted upon by the target agent. After this function returns the state of the message is either YAMI4Abandoned, YAMI4Replied or YAMI4Rejected.

Note: This function should not be called if the intended semantics of the message is "one-way" - in this case this function would block indefinitely.

- (BOOL) waitForCompletion: (unsigned long long)  timeout

Waits for the message roundtrip or until timeout expires.

Waits for the full message roundtrip or until the given relative timeout expires.

Parameters:
timeoutThe relative timeout in milliseconds.
Returns:
  • YES if the wait completed before the timeout
  • NO if the timeout expired before the message was completed
- (void) waitForTransmission

Waits for the transmission to finish.

Waits for the transmission to finish - that is, to either send all the message data or to abandon it. After this function returns the state of the message is either YAMI4Transmitted, YAMI4Abandoned, YAMI4Replied or YAMI4Rejected.

- (BOOL) waitForTransmission: (unsigned long long)  timeout

Waits for the transmission to finish or until timeout expires.

Waits for the transmission to finish or until the given relative timeout expires.

Parameters:
timeoutThe relative timeout in milliseconds.
Returns:
  • YES if the wait completed before the timeout
  • NO if the timeout expired before the message was fully transmitted
